[LEXICON]: Overly elaborate vocabulary (e.g., "gadding fashions," "feverish vogues") may slow reading.
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between Grasse’s description, historical events, and artistic context (e.g., jumps from Fragonard’s childhood to Pompadour’s influence).
[STRUCTURE]: Historical details (e.g., Louis XV’s scandals) feel slightly disconnected from Fragonard’s narrative arc.

[SYNTAX]: Occasional complex sentence structures may slightly impede immediate clarity (e.g., multiple nested clauses).
[LEXICON]: Rare archaic phrasing (e.g., "bag and baggage," "kinsman") could distract modern readers.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt shifts between Fragonard’s biography and broader historical events (e.g., Damiens’ assassination attempt).
[TRANSITION]: Lacking explicit connections between paragraphs (e.g., Marigny’s introduction feels disconnected from preceding art-focused narrative).
